archetype_name: Family Low-Sodium American & French Comfort (30–60, Mild)
name: Herb-Seared Tuna with Oven Ratatouille and Creamy Polenta
description: Seared tuna steaks with a lemon-herb finish, served alongside a low-sodium oven-roasted zucchini–tomato ratatouille and creamy buttered polenta. Family-friendly, mild, and from-scratch in under an hour.
prep_steps: Slice bell peppers into strips and onion into wedges.
Finely chop parsley and zest the lemon; cut lemon into wedges.
Pat tuna steak dry and season both sides with black pepper.
cook_steps: Roast vegetables: On a large sheet pan, toss zucchini, bell peppers, onion, tomatoes, and half the garlic with 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp thyme, and black pepper. Spread in a single layer and roast 20–25 minutes until tender and lightly browned, stirring once halfway.

Cook polenta: In a medium pot, bring 6 cups water to a boil. Whisk in polenta in a steady stream to avoid lumps. Reduce heat to low and simmer 20–25 minutes, stirring often, until thick and creamy. Stir in butter and a pinch of black pepper; keep warm covered.
Sear tuna: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Sear tuna steak 2–3 minutes per side for medium-rare (cook longer if preferred). Remove from heat.
Finish tuna: Sprinkle lemon zest and remaining garlic over the hot tuna in the pan; squeeze over some lemon juice.
Plate: Spoon polenta onto plates. Add roasted vegetables. Slice tuna if desired and place on top. Garnish with parsley and serve with extra lemon wedges.
